qas.question: In what country is the oldest evidence of ceremonial burial in the Horn of Africa located?
From what millennium do the oldest cemeteries in the Horn of Africa date?
At what site were important paleolithic stone tools found?
In what geographic part of Somalia were important paleolithic stone tools found?

context: The oldest evidence of burial customs in the Horn of Africa comes from cemeteries in <a0_0>Somalia<a0_0/> dating back to <a1_0>4th millennium BC<a1_0/>. The stone implements from <a2_0>the Jalelo site<a2_0/> in <a3_0>northern<a3_0/> Somalia are said to be the most important link in evidence of the universality in palaeolithic times between the East and the West.
